verses.verse: Then Zophar the Naamathite responded:
“Should we allow this torrent of words to go unanswered? Is a clever speaker always to be considered right?
Should your endless talk reduce others to silence? When you mock, is no one allowed to refute you?
For you said, ‘My judgments are irrefutable and I am blameless in the sight of God.’
Oh, how I wish that God would speak and open his lips to contradict your opinions
while revealing to you the secrets of wisdom, which puts human intelligence to shame. Thus, you might know that God will call you to account for your sin.
“Can you fathom the mysteries of God? Can you attain to the perfection of the Almighty?
It is higher than the heavens—what can you do? It is deeper than the netherworld—what can you know?
Its measure is longer than the earth and broader than the sea.
“If while passing by he decides to imprison you or subject you to judgment, who can prevent him?
He surely recognizes the deceitful; he will hardly ignore their iniquity.
An ignorant fool can no more gain understanding than a wild donkey can be domesticated.
“However, if you will have a change of heart and stretch out your hands toward him in prayer,
if you banish all iniquity far away from you and do not allow wickedness to penetrate your tent,
you will then be able to lift up your face in innocence; you will be unwavering and without fear.
You will then forget your wretchedness, remembering it only as flood waters gone by.
“Then your life will be brighter than noonday, and its darkness will be like morning.
You will be filled with confidence because there is hope; you will look around and take your rest in safety.
You will lie down without fearing anyone, and many will seek your favor.
But the eyes of the wicked will fail; for them all the ways of escape will be closed, and all they can hope for is death.”
